designScenario.name: HF Communication System
designScenario.description: Design an advanced HF Communication System engineered for secure, reliable, and robust long-range voice and data transmission in hazardous environments. The system integrates HF radio technology with modern avionics standards, ensuring electromagnetic compatibility and interference rejection. It serves as the primary communication backbone for air, land, and maritime platforms, prioritizing mission-critical data integrity and redundancy.

details.description: The system shall support HF voice communication, telex, and data transmission (e.g., weather, navigation, and tactical data) analogous to aircraft HF radio systems.
Enable interoperability with legacy HF systems and modern digital modes (e.g., SSB, VHF, and digital HF modems).
Achieve reliable communication within the HF spectrum (3–30 MHz) with latency under 500 milliseconds for voice and 2 seconds for data bursts.
Ensure data throughput of 12–24 kbps for digital HF modes, maintaining performance in ionospheric noise and multipath interference.
Implement AES-256 encryption for data and scrambler-based voice security to prevent eavesdropping, mirroring military-grade HF communication protocols.
Provide automatic frequency hopping and redundancy via multiple transceivers to ensure uninterrupted communication during solar flare-induced blackouts.
User interface must display frequency status, signal strength, and encryption status on a cockpit-style monitor, with tactile controls for emergency overrides.
Support over-the-air firmware updates for HF modem parameters and encryption keys via a secure, low-bandwidth channel.

systemComponents.name: Control Unit
systemComponents.description: Central processor managing HF communication protocols, frequency allocation, and system diagnostics, analogous to an aircraft's mission computer.

systemComponents.name: HF Transceiver Module
systemComponents.description: Handles HF signal modulation/demodulation (SSB, AM, FM), frequency tuning, and power amplification for long-range transmission.

subComponents.name: HF Modulator
subComponents.description: Converts digital data to analog HF signals using SSB or digital HF modem techniques.

subComponents.name: Power Amplifier
subComponents.description: Boosts signal strength for HF transmission up to 1 kW output, ensuring global range.

systemComponents.name: Antenna Array
systemComponents.description: Directional and omnidirectional antennas for HF reception/transmission, mitigating ionospheric noise and jamming.

subComponents.name: Vertical Antenna
subComponents.description: Primary antenna for omnidirectional HF coverage.

subComponents.name: Loop Antenna
subComponents.description: Directional antenna for reducing interference and improving signal directionality.

systemComponents.name: Signal Processor
systemComponents.description: Filters HF noise, corrects signal distortion, and prepares data for encryption.

subComponents.name: Noise Filter
subComponents.description: Removes atmospheric and man-made noise from received HF signals.

subComponents.name: Digital Signal Converter
subComponents.description: Converts analog HF signals to digital for processing and encryption.

systemComponents.name: Encryption Module
systemComponents.description: Secures HF transmissions via AES-256 for data and scrambler-based voice encryption.

subComponents.name: AES-256 Encryptor
subComponents.description: Encrypts digital HF data streams using AES-256.

subComponents.name: Voice Scrambler
subComponents.description: Applies frequency inversion and phase shift for secure voice communication.

systemComponents.name: Power Supply
systemComponents.description: Redundant power supply ensuring uninterrupted operation during primary power loss.

subComponents.name: DC Power Converter
subComponents.description: Converts aircraft DC power to regulated voltage for HF subsystems.

subComponents.name: Emergency Battery
subComponents.description: Backup battery providing 2 hours of operation during power failure.

relationships.description: The HF Transceiver Module transmits/receives signals via the Antenna Array, similar to aircraft HF radio-antenna coupling.
The Signal Processor forwards processed HF signals to the Encryption Module for security.
The Encryption Module depends on the Signal Processor for clean, noise-free signals before encryption.
The Control Unit orchestrates HF frequency selection and transmission power levels via the HF Transceiver Module.
All components rely on the Power Supply for regulated DC power and redundancy.

attributes.name: communicationChannels
attributes.description: Operates on HF radio bands (3–30 MHz) and modern digital HF modes (e.g., SSB, HFDL).

attributes.name: frequencyRange
attributes.description: Adheres to international HF aviation bands for global coverage and regulatory compliance.

attributes.name: encryptionProtocol
attributes.description: AES-256 for data and scrambler-based encryption for voice, ensuring security comparable to military HF systems.

attributes.name: performanceMetrics
attributes.description: Balances HF propagation delays with reliable data throughput for tactical and weather updates.

attributes.name: redundancy
attributes.description: Two HF transceivers and an emergency battery ensure operation during single-point failures.

constraintBlocks.name: HFPerformanceConstraint
constraintBlocks.expression: frequencyRange >= 3MHz AND frequencyRange <= 30MHz AND latency < 500ms AND throughput > 12kbps

comments.body: Military-grade HF system supporting long-range tactical communication with auto frequency hopping and 2-hour backup power
